block.p: Salima Vahabzadeh and Paul Kenneth Sheppard, who are vice presidents at investment banking firms in New York, were married here yesterday. The Rev. J. Donald Waring, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Grace Church. Afterward, Hossein Ebneyousef, an uncle of the bride, led a Persian cultural ceremony at the Peter White Studio.
The bride, 32, and bridegroom, 34, met at the University of Pennsylvania, where each received an M.B.A. degree, he as a Fulbright fellow.

Salima Vahabzadeh and Paul Kenneth Sheppard, who are vice presidents at investment banking firms in New York, were married here yesterday. The Rev. J. Donald Waring, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Grace Church. Afterward, Hossein Ebneyousef, an uncle of the bride, led a Persian cultural ceremony at the Peter White Studio.

Salima Vahabzadeh and Paul Kenneth Sheppard, who are vice presidents at investment banking firms in New York, were married here yesterday. The Rev. J. Donald Waring, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Grace Church. Afterward, Hossein Ebneyousef, an uncle of the bride, led a Persian cultural ceremony at the Peter White Studio.
The bride, 32, and bridegroom, 34, met at the University of Pennsylvania, where each received an M.B.A. degree, he as a Fulbright fellow.
She works at Allen & Company and is responsible for corporate finance mergers and acquisitions. He is at Evercore Partners and works on media company mergers and acquisitions.
The bride graduated from Cornell. She is the daughter of Veeda Gilanshah and Sohrab Vahabzadeh, both of New York.
The bridegroom graduated from Cambridge University in England. He is a son of Lindsay Law of Kingsbridge, England, and John Sheppard of Eastbourne, England.
